page.title: 04WINGRAVE SCHOOL
page.content: The old church rooms were used for the infants school from 1877-1918. The infants were then transfered to the community centre which was then the school. There were three teachers Mr. stubbs, his wife and Mrs.Rickard. In 1974 a new school had been completed at the other end of the village. There were many more teachers employed and the population of the school started to expand The school won several competitions, but the most remembered was when a class 1 pupil won a nationwide computer competition in his age group. For the prize the school recieved some computer equipment to the value of 3500 pounds. The school has also done well in athletics and swimming galas.
